revised_title: The Stability of a Spherical Nebula: Analyzing the Role of Gravitation and Rotation
tldr: This article examines the stability of a spherical nebula, focusing on the balance between gravitation and rotation. The author explores the differences between a compressible gas and an incompressible liquid, and how these differences affect the stability of a rotating mass of gas. The study also considers the role of elasticity and thermal conductivity in the stability of a gaseous nebula.
